channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Micro-Voting Could Give Politics A Needed Upgrade
item.description: Democracy was designed for a world of carrier pigeons. Micro-voting, biometric identity and decoupled governance could finally upgrade the signal-to-n...

item.title: Nestlé’s CEO drinks 8 coffees a day, but says Gen Z staffers are his secret to staying sharp by ‘learning constantly’
item.description: In his company turnaround effort, Nestlé CEO Philipp Navratil is drinking twice as much coffee as the average American to stay fueled—while admitting ...

item.title: January layoffs rose to the highest level for the month since 2009
item.description: Major employers including UPS and Amazon announced significant job cuts in January, with transportation and tech sectors leading the nationwide layoff...

item.title: The AI Talent Wars Have Hit Data Labeling
item.description: The AI Talent Wars Have Hit Data Labeling

item.title: OpenAI’s new model leaps ahead in coding capabilities—but raises unprecedented cybersecurity risks
item.description: Why OpenAI’s latest coding breakthrough is forcing the company to rethink how—and how fast—it can deploy its most powerful models

item.title: Cerebras Pockets $1 Billion To Challenge Nvidia In AI With ‘20X Faster’ Chip
item.description: Hello Nvidia. Here comes Cerebras, the new darling of AI compute, with a $10 billion OpenAI contract and a new $1 billion in a series H funding round.

item.title: Rocket CEO says U.S. mortgage industry is a ‘tale of two cities.’ His booming business shows a broader reality for American homebuyers
item.description: “Mortgage rates dropped to the lowest that they've been in the past three years,” Varun Krishna said, “and Rocket was right there to capitalize.”

item.title: Elon Musk’s Orbital Data Centers Face Huge Challenges
item.description: In this week’s edition of The Prototype, we look at the new inductees to the National Inventors Hall of Fame, 3D-printed housing and more.

item.title: Top analyst Tom Lee on gold’s black swan risk: Elon Musk becoming ‘the new central bank’
item.description: "It all fits in a swimming pool, all the gold in the world," the Fundstrat head of research said. Plus, it's "extraterrestrial."

item.title: Chrysler recalls more than 450,000 vehicles over brake light failure
item.description: Chrysler recalled more than 450,000 vehicles and more than 2,000 tow-trailer modules due to a brake light failure that could raise the risk of a crash...

item.title: How To Choose A Vehicle That Will Go In The Snow
item.description: It's no fun getting stuck or spinning out on icy or snowy roads. Here's how to ensure it doesn't happen next time Old Man Winter acts up.

item.title: Gen Z are rebelling against TikTok USA by installing another app—founded by an Oracle alum
item.description: TikTok USA isn't just (arguably) a tool of corporate power, it doesn't seem to work as well as the old TikTok.

item.title: China moves to ban feature commonly seen on Tesla vehicles over fear of trapped passengers
item.description: China bans electronic door handles starting 2027, requiring mechanical releases after safety incidents left passengers trapped inside vehicles.

item.title: Energy giant bets big on US, says its electricity market 'hottest' in the world

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
